item.description:
Invitation to an event from the National Black College Alliance. This will also be a launching pad for more regular business focused meetups.

Join us for a Discussion and Showcase of Young Black Entrepreneurism in Boston also meet several entrepreneurs in town, share your business ideas and get resources and support from older business mentors.

Monday, April 22th, 2013 from 6:00pm - 8:00pm

Dudley Public Library
65 Warren Street
Roxbury, MA 02119 (Dudley Square)

Join us in a community discussion on the YOUNG BLACK ENTERPRENEURISM in Boston. Meet several entrepreneurs share their business ideas, strategies and how they contribute to the "INNOVATION" market in BOSTON.

Join

Andre Porter, Office of Small Business and Entrepreneurship, Commonwealth of Massachusetts
Brent Harding, Pro Travel Network
Tina M. Andrews, Community Center for Entrepreneurship, Bunker Hill Community College
George "Chip" Greenidge, Greatest MINDS / National Black College Alliance
Karl Nurse, Massachusetts Black Business Alliance
Joyce Stanley, Dudley Main Streets
Jermain Germain, Minority Men Talk Group
Steven Wilson Jr., Gogetit Enterprises LLC
Daneja Bradley, 617LIVE
LV Randolph, Startup Lab Allston
Reginald Swift, StartupLab Allston
Liz Miranda, DSTination Lifestyles & Entertainment
Cornell Mills, Real Estate
Justin Springer, Out of the Box Agency
Richard Futrell, Cooking with Rich Futrell
Marvin Jones, Kinergy Power
Noah Jones, Preparation Markets & Premier Events
Brandon Bronough, TOP Notch Quality Service LLC
Ricardo Pierre Louis, Prive Valet Parking
Sheena Brown, Entertainment and Event Planning
item.how_to_find_us: I'll post a meeting spot when I get there
item.name: Discussion and Showcase of Young Black Entrepreneurism in Boston
